Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2008 11:41AM Jaydee wrote: Since posting I have had blood tests taken and all came back clear.   At hospital yesterday and told by Consultant that inflammation of membranes is a sign of stress to the body,possibly the rads or even Tamoxifen.  As my gums are still red and I am still fatigued she suggested I stop Tamoxifen for one month and see if this helps - not keen to do this.  My husband asked if my problem could be due to having inadvertently received radiotherapy to the sternum (where blood cells are processed) and the reply was a nod!  Basically I can do no more - have been using Gengigel mouthwash which is very soothing.  Am fastidious about oral hygeine and have found this quite distressing.  Glad to get this off my chest!  Best wishes to all.
Posts.Title: Stomatitis after radiotherapy Jaydee Jaydee

Posts.Content: Jaydee wrote: Two months after I finished radiotherapy in October following a Lumpectomy early September I noticed that my gums were very red and puffy looking - this was followed by ulcers all over my mouth.  My Dentist said he has seen this before following radiation and is due to the effect on the immune system.  As I post this I also have a lesion like a cold-sore on my ankle which is very swollen.  Am seeing my GP in a few days but wondered if anyone else has had similar problems.
